title: Isolate the Quadratic Term
text: We add $$3$$ on both sides to get $$y^2$$ by itself which gives $$\frac{3}{4} y^2=21$$.
speech: We add  3  on both sides to get  y squared  by itself which gives  3 fourths y squared is equal to 21 .

title: Make the Leading Coefficient "1"

title: Use Square root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $$y^2=28$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$y=\sqrt{28}$$ or $$y=-\sqrt{28}$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$\frac{3}{4} y^2-3=18$$ has two solutions which are $$y=-2\sqrt{7}$$, and $$y=2\sqrt{7}$$.
